Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Polybia-MP-III (Polybia-MPIII; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Activity against G+ and G- bacteria such as  E. coli (MIC 38 uM),  S. aureus (MIC 19 uM), and B. cereus (MIC 38 uM), P.aeruginosa (MIC 310 uM), and A. baumannii (MIC 12.5-25 uM).Toxicity: This toxin (peptide) also induce lysis of rat erythrocytes.  human RBC: HC50 38.5 uM; rat RBC: HC50 74.8 uM (Ye et al., 2023). In addition, the peptide presents mast cell degranulation activity, LDH release from the cytoplasm of mast cells, chemotaxis for PMNL.Structure: Helical in the presence of SDS or TFE. 10/30/2010; Jan2017; 7/2021; 7/2024.
Literature Information.Author: de Souza BM, da Silva AV, Resende VM, Arcuri HA, Dos Santos Cabrera MP, Ruggiero Neto J, Palma MS.2009
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of two novel polyfunctional mastoparan peptides from the venom of the social wasp Polybia paulista
